whatIs.title: An intelligent assistant for your motorhome routes.
whatIs.prec1: Artificial Intelligence (like ChatGPT) is great, but it needs precise instructions (prompts) to deliver truly usable results.
whatIs.prec2: Camping Route is a pure frontend tool that runs completely locally in your browser. You select your preferences via a simple form.
whatIs.prec3: We convert your input into a perfectly structured text that the AI understands optimally.
whatIs.ai1: No more standard routes, but 100% individualized.
whatIs.ai2: Takes vehicle dimensions, budget, and preferences into account.
whatIs.ai3: Saves you from tedious typing and clarifying with the AI.

diff.q: Prompt vs. Direct AI ‚Äì what's the difference?
diff.title: The choice is yours: copy for free or generate directly in the app.
diff.gen1: At the end you receive a finished text prompt.
diff.gen2: Simply copy it and paste it into ChatGPT, Claude or Gemini.
diff.gen3: Free of charge and you use your existing AI account.
diff.gen4: Full control over the subsequent chat.
diff.ai: Mode: Use AI Directly (API Key needed)
diff.ai1: The route is generated and displayed directly in our app.
diff.ai2: No copying back and forth between different tabs.
diff.ai4: You need your own API key from your AI provider.

howItWorks.q: How exactly does the planning work?
howItWorks.title: To your perfect itinerary in just a few steps.
howItWorks.step1a: Set start, destination, duration and max daily kilometers.
howItWorks.step2a: Enter vehicle dimensions, weight and self-sufficiency (power/water).
howItWorks.step3a: Copy prompt (and paste manually into ChatGPT etc) OR enter your own API key to show the route directly in the app.

cost.q: Is it really free to use?
cost.title: Yes, Camping Route is a free open-source project.
cost.free1: Using the form and prompt generation is 100% free.
cost.free2: No registration, no database, no backend.
cost.transDesc: Only if you want to 'Use AI directly', you enter your OWN API key. You pay the minimal API usage fees (usually a few cents per route) directly to your AI provider (OpenAI, Google, Mistral). We as an app have nothing to do with this, earn nothing from it, and do not cover API costs!

privacy.q: What happens to my entered data?
privacy.title: Your data stays on your device.
privacy.device1: We have no backend and no database! All inputs (incl. API keys) are saved only locally on your device in your browser (Local Storage).
privacy.sec1: Your data only leaves your device if you send it directly to the API of the chosen AI provider.

aiModel.q: Which AI model should I choose?
aiModel.title: Each model has its own strengths in route planning.
aiModel.gemini1: Extremely good with current places, pitches, and POIs as it uses Google's massive database. Often generates the most realistic and beautiful routes for Europe.
aiModel.gpt1: Logically unbeatable. Strictly adheres to constraints like max daily kilometers and budgets. The text output of version 5.2 is highly structured and extremely detailed.
aiModel.mistral1: A strong European model. Works very fast and offers excellent value for money (the API is often cheaper than OpenAI).
aiModel.recDesc: Tip: For the best campsite recommendations and scenic highlights, we currently recommend Google Gemini.

general.title: General Data Processing
general.description: Protecting your data is very important to us. CampingRoute.app is designed as a pure client-side application. This means we do not operate databases or create user accounts. All data you enter remains primarily in your browser.

local.title: Local Storage
local.description: To make your experience as smooth as possible, we save your form inputs and settings (such as chosen language or entered API keys) exclusively locally in your browser (Local Storage). This data is never transmitted to our servers.

ai.title: AI Integration (OpenAI, Gemini, Mistral)
ai.description: If you use direct AI generation, your form data (start, destination, vehicle, preferences) is converted into text (prompt) and sent directly to your chosen AI provider (OpenAI, Google Gemini, or Mistral AI) using your own API key. We do not store this traffic or log API keys. The privacy policies of the AI provider you use apply.

sidebar.description: CampingRoute.app does not use tracking cookies that require consent (like Google Analytics, Meta Pixel, etc.). We do not use any mechanisms to analyze your user behavior.

noTracking.description: Only essential, technically necessary information for the React app to function (e.g. for multi-language support via i18next) is kept locally in the browser.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.description: Since we do not store personal data on our servers, the traditional right to deletion or information requests from us does not apply. You have full control over your data at all times: to remove all settings saved by CampingRoute.app, simply clear your browser data (Local Storage) for this website.

prompt.systemRole: You are a professional motorhome route planner with specialized knowledge of Germany and international travel destinations. Create a practical, well-structured motorhome route based on my specifications. Consider vehicle specifications, travel destinations, budget requirements, and personal preferences. If real-time data (e.g., traffic, availability, exact prices) is not available, work with plausible estimates, mark them as such, and indicate what I should check myself in the navigation system or a camping app. Respond in language: {{language}}.
prompt.instructions:
Plan the route with the parameters mentioned above and structure your response into modules with clear headings. Do not use asterisks (*) or double asterisks (**) in the response.

1. Stage Planning (Daily kilometers, driving time, breaks every 2-3 hours, alternative routes if applicable, and brief justification).

2. Overnight Stays (Specific campsites/pitches (and alternatives) with brief descriptions; include links and approximate price ranges where possible, but mark prices as estimates).

3. Highlights & Activities (Top 3 per stage, briefly with costs/opening hours if known).

4. Practical Tips (Navigation, waste disposal, emergency information).

5. Best Travel Time & Duration (Brief section).

6. Services on the Road (Fuel, supermarkets, workshops).

7. Additional Info (Budget guidance, sustainability, health, connectivity).

8. Technology & Equipment (Short checklist, app recommendations).

9. Flexibility (Alternative routes, legal notes on wild camping, tools for further optimization).

Important: Use your internal map knowledge, if available, to roughly calculate distances and typical driving times between stages. Provide distances in km and driving times in hours/minutes, and mark them as estimates (e.g., "approx. 230 km / 3:00-3:30 h"). Avoid exact precision if you do not have access to current routing data, and explicitly ask me to verify the route in the navigation system (e.g., Google Maps, Here, Garmin, OpenStreetMap app).

GPX File: Generate the GPX-XML data for this route at the end of the response in GPX 1.1 format. Include start, all stages, overnight stays, and the destination as waypoints (<wpt>) and the overall route as a track (<trk>). No explanations for the XML.
